fact_list.fact_text: At a junction, look right, then left, then right again.
Do not proceed at a junction until you are sure that it is safe to do so.
Do not rely on signals from unauthorized persons to proceed.
Well before turning right at a junction, take full account of the position and movement of traffic behind you.
Signal your intention and take up a position left of center on a two-way street or in the extreme right lane of a one-way street when safe to do so.
Wait until there is a safe distance between you and any approaching vehicle before completing your turn.
When turning right into a two-way street, turn into the lane just left of the center line of the road you are turning into.
When turning right into a one-way street, turn into the extreme right lane of the road you are turning into.
If you intend to turn left, keep to the left, signal in good time, and do not swing out to the right before or after making the turn.
When a vehicle turns, the rear nearside wheel tends to pull closer to the curb, which requires special care to avoid brushing against pedestrians, bicycles, or motorcycles.
Notice the wide difference between the arcs taken by the front and rear nearside wheels during a turn.
Slow down when approaching a roundabout and give way to traffic on your right.
Traffic coming from your right at a roundabout takes priority over you.
Motorists must always give way to traffic approaching from their right at a roundabout.
Exercise caution at all times and decide early which exit to take at a roundabout.
Take note of and act on all information available from traffic signs, lights, and road markings to direct you into the correct lane.
As a motorist, always give clear signals showing your intentions in good time.
Obey the right-hand rule when driving.
Do not inconvenience other drivers while driving.
Use your mirror intelligently to ensure you do not obstruct the path of vehicles behind you.
Show consideration to other road users in the interest of road safety.
